moves.5. exd5 a6 6. Bxc6+ bxc6 7. dxc6 Qxc6: White remains up a pawn in this exchange.
moves.8. O-O f6 9. d3 Ne7 10. Re1 Nf5 11. Nbd2: Black gets a pawn, white takes the bishop.
moves.29. Nxe7+ Kg7 30. Rf1 Qb7 31. Nf5+ Bxf5: Nd1 forks black's queen and rook.  But a knight and two pawns is worth the rook.  34. NxR, QxNe3+ lets black defend Pf6 with 37. Kh1 (or Rf2) Qb6.
